parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>False. There is no CMF number present in the provided post information.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>True. The post explicitly mentions Mircea Geoana and encourages voters to support the Partidul România în Acțiune Mehedinți.  While it doesn't directly name him as a candidate, the context strongly implies he is associated with the party and the parliamentary elections. This fulfills Article 36 (7) - a.</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>True. This is a paid Facebook post, inherently designed to reach a wide audience. The targeting data shows a significant reach across Mehedinți County, indicating an attempt to address the general public, fulfilling Article 36 (7) - c.</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>True. The primary objective of the post is to encourage voters to support Partidul România în Acțiune Mehedinți. The call to action ("vote for...") is implicit but clear given the context of the post and the timing (during the election period). This fulfills Article 36 (7) - c. The hashtags further reinforce the electoral objective.</electoral-objective>
<journalism>False. The post lacks the characteristics of journalistic reporting. It's not presenting objective information or analysis but rather promoting a specific political party.  It's promotional in nature, not informative.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>False. The post is not expressing a personal opinion; it's a direct appeal for votes, a clear act of political campaigning.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>1328605544774777</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The Facebook post, paid for by Partidul România în Acțiune Mehedinți, promotes the party by explicitly mentioning Mircea Geoana and implicitly urging voters to support them.  The post's targeting data shows a wide reach within Mehedinți County.  The content is clearly designed to influence the outcome of the parliamentary elections, fulfilling all criteria of electoral propaganda as defined by Article 36 (7) of LEGE nr. 334 din 17 iulie 2006.  The post's timing, during the election period, further strengthens this conclusion.  While there's no explicit call to vote, the context makes the intention undeniably clear.  The absence of a CMF number is not a mitigating factor, as the post's content and context clearly indicate electoral propaganda.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>TRUE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates>
  <candidate><name>Mircea Geoana</name><impact>POSITIVE</impact></candidate>
</electoral-propaganda-candidates>
<responsible-party-or-group>PRA</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police>
Partidul România în Acțiune Mehedinți, pentru încălcarea articolului 98 t) din LEGEA nr. 208 din 20 iulie 2015, prin publicarea unei postări plătite pe Facebook (ID: 1328605544774777) după ora 18:00 pe 23.11.2024, care promovează Partidul România în Acțiune Mehedinți și pe Mircea Geoana, având ca efect electoral influențarea voturilor în favoarea partidului. Postarea, cu o cheltuială de 700-799 RON, a atins 30.000-35.000 de impresii și o estimare a acoperirii de 100.000-500.000 de persoane în județul Mehedinți.  Textul postării „Mircea Geoana îndeamnă românii să voteze Partidul România în Acțiune Mehedinți!” și hashtag-urile utilizate (#mirceageoana #AlegeriParlamentare) demonstrează clar intenția de a influența votul.  Informațiile de contact ale advertiserului sunt disponibile în Ad Library: part9419@partidulromaniainactiunemehedinti.info și +40743302640.
</message-for-police>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
